name: Interrupt Driven RGB
tagline: Interrupt Driven Reverse Geocaching Box Project
body:
### Reverse Geocaching Box?
What is that, you say? In the simplest of terms, it's like regular geocaching, except you start with the cache locked in a box that is location sensitive (it has a GPS). You take the box to the appropriate location and it will open up! How do you know what location to take it to, you ask? There is a screen on the top of the box which tells you what direction to go and how far to go in that direction. It's probably best to use Google Maps to try to determine where you really need to go. Sounds cool, huh?

### This Project
Oh, you've seen these before? What's so special about our box? We decided to take it a couple steps further. First, the box doesn't just open when you get to the designated location. It's programming allows for multiple locations to be set and the box only opens once you get to the last location. I know what you're thinking, it's sounds like more trouble than it's worth. Well, there's a reason for all of the different locations. The box has a greater purpose.

### The Technical Details
All the other RGB projects I've seen use a module that cuts power to the MCU. While that extremely effective, it's also kind of boring. We decided to use low power modules with sleep functions to reduce their power consumption when not in use. It also sports a USB charging circuit so that the 2500mAh battery is ready when you need it. The display is a color OLED display with a handy microSD card slot. The location data is stored on the card so it can be easily configured and tweaked before it's deployed.

### Authors and Contributors
TJ Peden (@tpeden) is the Engineer and Developer of the project. Patrick Reames (@patrickr) designed and planned the project and as soon as it's completed, he will be the one to deploy the box. More on that in the weeks to come!

Pictures and additional information are coming, please be patient
